results.title: The Fairy faith
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Kent Martin, National Film Board of Canada and John Walker Productions
results.brief_description: Fairies, fair folk, elves, trolls, pixies, brownies, goblins… Before being relegated to the realm of childhood fantasy by the scientific thinking of Victorian times, fairies existed as part of a rich and ancient belief system practised in many cultures. Filmmaker John Walker investigates the continued appeal of fairy lore in a world obsessed with materialism and rational thinking in this beautifully filmed documentary filled with the stunning landscapes that have fuelled tales of fairy folk for generations. He travels to the moors of England, the Highlands of Scotland, and sacred sites within Ireland and Cape Breton, discussing the origins of fairy lore, sightings of “the little people” and modern attitudes to the fairy faith. Walker interviews artist Brian Froud and reveals the inspiration for his fairy artworks, discusses the reality and physical possibility of fairies with scholar in seeing the paranormal Dr. Mark Fox, and meets Eddie Lenihan, a storyteller who saves an old fairy thorn tree from being destroyed by town developers.

results.title: The Fad diet circus
results.brief_description: Shows the potential hazards of fad diets, which seldom result in long-term weight loss. Compares two groups of dieters, one on a well balanced diet and the other on a low carbohydrate diet. Shows how both groups lose weight but the low carbohydrate group experiences medical problems.

results.title: The Face of the high Arctic
results.creator_credit: Dalton Muir, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A study of the geological evolution that has gone on for millions of years. Treeless wastes bear evidence of glaciers that advanced and receded, and of life forms that changed with the climate. The film tracks the cataclysmic forces that passed over this Arctic land.

results.title: The Face of Red China
results.creator_credit: Av Westin, Leslie Midgley and CBS News
results.brief_description: Walter Cronkite interviews Gerald Clark, an experienced Canadian reporter, against a background of film photographed in China by Rolf Gilhausen in 1958. This film covers life on farms, in cities and factories in a country which was then rapidly becoming a real Marxist state, with communal life and communal ownership. Vast resources of human energy were used on the building of dams and bridges with very few machines. The fundamental changes in family life, the indoctrination program, the question of Soviet assistance and the growth of secondary industry.

results.brief_description: This disc contains over 3,700 photographs, the full text of “Naming North Sydney” (an historical dictionary of place names) and the full text of 24 heritage leaflets. It has been produced by North Sydney Council’s Stanton Library. The Local Studies Collection, from which the photographs are taken is located within the library (234 Miller Street, North Sydney).

results.title: The Face of Lincoln
results.creator_credit: Edward Freed, Wilbur T. Blume and University of Southern California
results.brief_description: Professor Merrell Gage, head of the Department of Sculpture at the University of Southern California, describes the life and career of Abraham Lincoln as he sculptures from clay a life-like bust of the President, making physical changes in the subject’s face, hair, beard and expression to correspond with events in Lincoln’s life.

results.title: The Face of Italy
results.creator_credit: Austin Steele and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Italy is a country steeped deep in the cultural riches of an ancient land juxtaposed with the cosmopolitan chic of the new. Her cities, equally important in their contribution to Italy’s cultural tapestry, have played host to many world events, and 1990 is no exception when twelve of them host soccer’s premier competition, the World Cup. Features : Rome, Naples, Bari, Genoa, Florence and Verona. Presented by Les Murray.
